metadata.title: Providing metadata for xHE-AAC video soundtracks

inlineContent.text: Soundtracks that use xHE-AAC (Extended High-Efficiency Advanced Audio Codec) encoding
include MPEG-D DRC metadata for loudness and dynamic range control (DRC). When you
create video soundtracks with xHE-AAC, provide at least the following metadata to
ensure consistent results across different services. For playback, set up the MPEG-D
DRC tool at the decoder by following the guidelines below.
Refer to ISO/IEC 23003-4 for additional information about these metadata
The loudness and DRC metadata that you include in video content needs to fulfill
the MPEG-D DRC requirements for the Basic DRC Metadata Profile, and always include
Measure anchor loudness using speech-gating or estimate when speech activity is low.
True peak according to ITU-R BS.1770 or sample peak level.
Measure anchor loudness of the dialog stem using the ITU-R BS.1770 standard because
must reflect the actual anchor loudness of the content. Apply speech-gating
to the full mix to obtain the anchor loudness value when only the full mix is available
Anchor loudness can be inaccurate when the speech detector can’t find much speech
in the full mix. Monitor this situation by computing the speech activity, which is
the duration of detected speech divided by the duration of the content. When speech
activity is low, ignore this measurement because it can be inaccurate. Instead, derive
the anchor loudness value from the program loudness value and other applicable measurements
to model the value from statistics of a variety of content. See
